key_title: Key to the species of Chiloglottis

Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the families in the Asparagales-Liliales complex
Key to the genera of Orchidaceae

leads.lead_text: Petals spreading or incurved (rarely deflexed against ovary, and if so, labellum elliptic to oblong); labellum broadest towards base or middle
Petals deflexed against the ovary; labellum broadest towards tip
Flowers mostly pale green; labellum narrowly ovate with more or less sessile glands
Flowers often darkly coloured or tinted; labellum broadly ovate or elliptical with at least some stalked glands
Labellum broadly elliptical with a central ant-like cluster of stalked and sessile glands
Labellum broadly ovate to cordate with several scattered individual stalked and sessile glands
Flower to 30 mm across; dorsal sepal <10 mm wide; petals spreading widely; labellum to 12 mm across
Flower to 40 mm across; dorsal sepal >10 mm wide; petals incurved; labellum >12 mm across
Labellum obliquely erect, callus a single central ant-like cluster of sessile glands
Labellum horizontal or slightly deflexed, callus a large cluster of stalked and sessile glands
Glands concentrated near centre of labellum lamina and extending well short of apex
Glands covering much of labellum lamina and extending virtually to apex
Main callus gland held well above other glands when viewed in profile; lateral sepals 10–13 mm long, usually recurved, with thickened clubs 2–3 mm long
Main callus gland more or less continuous with other glands when viewed in profile; lateral sepals 15–18 mm long, usually deflexed, with thickened clubs 3–5 mm long
